intro: Laennecia altoandina, commonly known as the Andean laennecia, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
